medical_history.chief_complaint: Neonatal inflammatory skin and bowel lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The skin lesions developed on the second day of life, with diarrhea developing in the first week of life. The diarrhea was predominantly bloody with malabsorptive characteristics, worsening with the severity of the skin disease and exacerbated by gastrointestinal infections.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Affected girl had chronic diarrhea and failure to thrive starting at 4 months of age, and died at 12 years of age from myocarditis. Affected boy was found to have left ventricular dilation and had skin prone to Staphylococcus aureus infections.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are consanguineous (first cousins) of Lebanese origin. Two out of three children have the same clinical features.
